page.title: 12The village of Trehafod
page.content: Trehafod is a village between Porth and Pontypridd.The two River Rhonddas, joined at Porth,flow through the middle.Many of the houses are built in the valley between the two mountains, while the rest are built on the mountainside.Many of its buildings are between 80 and 100 years old.People have been modernising their homes which are strong stone buildings. However,many of the shops and all of the chapels-except St Barnabas Church- have closed.It was a busy mining village but now the last colliery,the Lewis Merthyr,has closed.People have to travel to other places to work. It is also a much quieter place because a by-pass has been built alongside the railway.Through traffic to the Rhondda now uses the by-pass instead of the village. By Alison John of Hafod CP school.
